Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk p11-kit
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: p11-kit bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated p11-kit packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The p11-kit packages provide a mechanism to manage PKCS#11 modules. The p11-kit-trust subpackage includes a PKCS#11 trust module that provides certificate anchors and black lists based on configuration files.
The p11-kit packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.20.7, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version, including thread-safe readdir() function, a fix for minor integer overflow in the p11_buffer_append() function, a fix for occasional segmentation fault in the p11_buffer_append() function, and an API that implements the external trust policy. Moreover, this update adds a 'trust' tool to configure root certificate anchors on the system. It also adds API that allows for other system components such as GnuTLS to accept the certificate trust information. (BZ#1122528, BZ#984989, BZ#985009, BZ#985019, BZ#985497, BZ#1125965, BZ#1142305)
This update also fixes the following bugs:
* With this update, the behavior of static local variables has been optimized to prevent accidental writes to these variables. (BZ#985337)
* Due to a bug in the coolkey p11-kit module, when using this module, other modules were not included in the /etc/pki/nssdb file. This bug has been fixed, and all p11-kit modules are now added to /etc/pki/nssdb as expected. (BZ#1128615)
* Previously, multi-arch installations on IBM System z failed to integrate with Network Security Services (NSS). This bug has been fixed, and multi-arch installs now integrate with NSS correctly. (BZ#1174178)
Users of p11-kit are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. This update is required by gnutls 3.3.x packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
